solution_04_inferential_statistics/03_hypothesis_tests_one_sample/01_hyptest_single_mean_v2

video

We need to calculate the \(p\)-value. \[\begin{aligned} p\text{-value} &= P\left(\big|Z\big| > \frac{\big|\bar{x}-\mu_0\big|}{\sigma_0/\sqrt{n}} \right) \\\\ &= P\left(\big|Z\big| > \frac{\big|25.14-26.6\big|}{7.5/\sqrt{89}} \right) \\\\ &= P\left(\big|Z\big| > 1.8364817 \right) \\\\ &= 0.0662865 \end{aligned}\]

Of course you could have rounded the \(z\) score. Either of the following will also get credit.

\[p\text{-value} ~=~ \left(\big|Z\big| > -1.84 \right) ~=~ 0.0658\] \[p\text{-value} ~=~ \left(\big|Z\big| > -1.83 \right) ~=~ 0.0672\]


  1. 0.0662865
  2. FALSE / TRUE
